episode_summary: This episode covers a variety of intriguing topics, including NASA's unconventional method of fixing a Mars probe, the mystery behind the Greek philosopher Plato's real name, the use of explosive moss in early internal combustion engines, and the structural importance of foot arches, likened to folding a slice of pizza.

facts.fact: NASA fixed its Mars probe by getting it to whack itself with a shovel.
We don't know what the Greek philosopher Plato's real name was. Plato was his wrestling nickname.
The first ever internal combustion engine was partially powered by explosive moss.
We have arches in our feet for the same reason that we fold slices of pizza.
